boat.name: Stormy Petrel
boat.full_description:
'Stormy Petrel' is a Whitstable oyster smack built by Charles and Richard Perkins. She was owned by Seasalter and Ham, the oyster fishery company, and employed as their watch boat until just after the Second World War.

Just after the war she was purchased by Bob Roberts, of SB Cambria, and then bought by Mr. Richard Norris in 1962. She has been extensively refitted and restored, being the last Whitstable smack without an engine.

In 1968 she won  the East Coast OGA Tom Bolton Memorial Cup, and the first true smack over the line in the 1968 Maldon Regatta Smack Race.

Read a 2013 article in Classic Boat, CB278.
boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine on oak sawn frames
boat.short_description: 'Stormy Petrel' was built in Whitsable, Kent, 1890 by Dick and Charlie Perkins. Until 1928 she fished for the famed Thames oysters.
